pylovo
  • Pylovo GUI
  • Javascript API Reference
  • Urbs Editor
  • commodity_editor.js
  • View page source

commodity_editor.js

fetchCommodityProfiles()

retrieves commodity feature templates from the backend and generates a dict for each commodity, holding default values for all inputs

openNewCommodityForm()

opens the GUI form for creating a new commodity

closeNewCommodityForm()

closes the GUI form for creating a new commodity and resets its input values

commodityFormCheckValidInput(comm_name)

makes sure we cannot create a commodity with now name and enables or disables the confirm button in the new commodity form

Arguments:

  • comm_name (string) – text contained in the input field for a new commodity name

addCommToProcessCreationFormList(name)

Once a new commodity has been created, this function adds it to the GUI forms for creating new commodities and adding commodities to processes

Arguments:

  • name (string) – of the new commodity

addCommToStorageComList(name)

Once a new commodity has been created, this function adds it to the GUI form of the storage editor

Arguments:

  • name (string) – the name of the commodity

createNewCommodity(com_name)

adds the newly created commodity to the commodity editor list, the pro_conf table and the CommodityObject

Arguments:

  • com_name (string) – the name of the commodity

writeBackCommodityFeatures(target)

onchange function for all commodity editor input fields writes changed value back to the relevant entry in the CommodityObject

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – the html element whose onchange event called the function
